request_process.legal_authority: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act - SC Code 30-4-10 et seq.
request_process.how_to_request: Written or verbal request to appropriate agency with reasonable time and place restrictions

agency_response_time.initial_response: 15 calendar days to provide record, explanation for delay, or basis for refusal
agency_response_time.fulfillment: 30 calendar days for most records; 35 days for records over 24 months old

fees.copying: Actual costs of search, retrieval, and reproduction
fees.deposit: Up to 25% deposit required if costs exceed $25

request_process.appeals_process: Circuit court action for declaratory judgment, injunction, or mandamus; discretionary attorney fees; $500 civil fine for arbitrary violations

key_exemptions: Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Personal information constituting unreasonable invasion of privacy
Law enforcement records that would interfere with proceedings or endanger safety
Real estate appraisals for pending acquisitions
Library patron records and circulation details
Income tax returns and scholastic records
notable_features: Liberal construction in favor of openness
All public meetings must be open to public
Recording of public meetings permitted if not disruptive
One-year statute of limitations for enforcement actions
Civil fine of $500 for arbitrary and capricious violations
Discretionary attorney fees for both parties
Expedited timeline for recent records (30 days vs 35 days)
